description: The Microsoft Technology Associate (MTA) validates building-block technology concepts and helps students explore, discover and pursue successful careers in Information Technology (IT) in an exciting and rewarding way! As the first step in the Microsoft Technology Certification Series, this new, entry-level certification provides students with confidence, credibility, and differentiation while focusing on the knowledge required for the 98-366: MTA Networking Fundamentals Exam.  This exam tests your knowledge about networking basics and the configuration of network settings and also covers the basic hardware one will find as network technicians in the field, terminology one is likely to encounter, and about the OSI model and different internet protocols which are foundational to all of networking. To gain an MTA certification, you must pass only one MTA exam.

This exam tests your knowledge about networking basics and the configuration of network settings and also covers the basic hardware one will find as network technicians in the field, terminology one is likely to encounter, and about the OSI model and different internet protocols which are foundational to all of networking. To gain an MTA certification, you must pass only one MTA exam.
name: MTA - Networking Fundamentals - 98-366 (UPDATE 2018)
subtitle: Networking Fundamentals

episodes.description: a
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.372 --> 00:00:06.388
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:06.388 --> 00:00:09.135
Hello and welcome to the overview for

3
00:00:09.135 --> 00:00:13.483
the MTA Networking Fundamentals for
Exam 98-366.

4
00:00:13.483 --> 00:00:15.891
If you're looking for
a career in networking, but

5
00:00:15.891 --> 00:00:18.980
you have no networking experience,
you're in the right place.

6
00:00:18.980 --> 00:00:23.754
This is where we will talk about some
of the basic fundamental concepts that

7
00:00:23.754 --> 00:00:28.551
you need to have at least knowledge of
as you go into a career in networking.

8
00:00:28.551 --> 00:00:32.458
So this show will help you out,
if you are actually preparing for that.

9
00:00:32.458 --> 00:00:37.357
So the way that we'll actually cover this,
of course is based on the official exam

10
00:00:37.357 --> 00:00:42.045
objectives found from the Microsoft
website that has details about the exam.

11
00:00:42.045 --> 00:00:44.678
It'll also help you to get ready for
the exam too.

12
00:00:44.678 --> 00:00:46.830
So let's go ahead and
take a look at that website.

13
00:00:46.830 --> 00:00:51.843
Now I pulled this up by simply
in my favorite search engine,

14
00:00:51.843 --> 00:00:54.464
typing in exam 98-366.

15
00:00:54.464 --> 00:00:57.343
This exam has been around for
a while as you can see.

16
00:00:57.343 --> 00:01:01.213
But over here on the right-hand side, this
is kinda the most important part is that

17
00:01:01.213 --> 00:01:04.718
if you're actually right here in the US,
it'll cost you about $127.

18
00:01:04.718 --> 00:01:07.949
If you're outside the United States,
make sure you click on this link.

19
00:01:07.949 --> 00:01:10.757
That will, of course,
tell you what the price is gonna be for

20
00:01:10.757 --> 00:01:12.755
wherever you'll be scheduling the exam.

21
00:01:12.755 --> 00:01:17.144
When you're ready after your studying
to prepare to take the exam,

22
00:01:17.144 --> 00:01:21.233
you can schedule a Certiport or
Peasron VUE from this website.

23
00:01:21.233 --> 00:01:25.109
You can click on it and find out
details about what you need to do, and

24
00:01:25.109 --> 00:01:27.295
get registered for that exam as well.

25
00:01:27.295 --> 00:01:31.717
You'll make sure that you have to, of
course, pay the actual fee for the exam as

26
00:01:31.717 --> 00:01:35.624
well as understand their instructions and
be there in plenty of time.

27
00:01:35.624 --> 00:01:38.725
Make sure that everything is
actually going to be what you need.

28
00:01:38.725 --> 00:01:39.990
Now during our show,

29
00:01:39.990 --> 00:01:44.493
what we are going to be covering is
gonna be underneath the skills measured.

30
00:01:44.493 --> 00:01:47.685
So this website will help
you to be able to do that.

31
00:01:47.685 --> 00:01:52.455
Now even though they list a bunch of
different things that we'll be covering,

32
00:01:52.455 --> 00:01:57.370
well, this one's a little bit unusual in
the very the fact that they've updated

33
00:01:57.370 --> 00:02:00.063
the exam objective
a little bit of time ago.

34
00:02:00.063 --> 00:02:03.574
If I scroll in on the last
paragraph right before,

35
00:02:03.574 --> 00:02:08.855
it tells you that there have been
updates as of January 31st, 2018.

36
00:02:08.855 --> 00:02:12.839
So that means what you'll actually
get is this, click on this link.

37
00:02:12.839 --> 00:02:17.108
And when you click on this link,
it'll download for you a PDF and

38
00:02:17.108 --> 00:02:20.206
that PDF will have
the exam objective update.

39
00:02:20.206 --> 00:02:23.568
So the way that outlook, of course
is now when you take a look at it,

40
00:02:23.568 --> 00:02:25.669
you will end up seeing
that you will get a,

41
00:02:25.669 --> 00:02:28.575
you'll downloads a document
that would look like this.

42
00:02:28.575 --> 00:02:33.124
And then it will give you all of
the different topics and different

43
00:02:33.124 --> 00:02:38.761
technologies that would be covering in
the networking fundamentals, as well.

44
00:02:38.761 --> 00:02:41.049
So the way that we cover
this is out of order.

45
00:02:41.049 --> 00:02:45.981
A more logical order here and I start
off with understanding protocols, and

46
00:02:45.981 --> 00:02:47.300
services.

47
00:02:47.300 --> 00:02:51.006
We'll be taking a look at the OSI model,
as well as the IP addressing

48
00:02:51.006 --> 00:02:55.507
that you'll be using and the two different
versions that are out there right now.

49
00:02:55.507 --> 00:02:59.681
The understanding of name resolution and
why it's so important to us as well as

50
00:02:59.681 --> 00:03:04.173
different services you're likely to
encounter in a business-like environment,

51
00:03:04.173 --> 00:03:06.781
and what those things actually do for
you, too.

52
00:03:06.781 --> 00:03:11.875
And then of course, the basic protocol
of the internet itself which is TCP/IP.

53
00:03:11.875 --> 00:03:15.742
We'll take a look at the tools that are
actually there for us, so that we can do

54
00:03:15.742 --> 00:03:18.912
a little bit of troubleshooting
on our own in terms of network.

55
00:03:18.912 --> 00:03:23.443
In that point, we will also end up
addressing networking hardware.

56
00:03:23.443 --> 00:03:27.336
Networking hardware will allow us to
understand more about switches and

57
00:03:27.336 --> 00:03:28.291
what they do, and

58
00:03:28.291 --> 00:03:32.332
some of the different details on how
they end up working as well as routers.

59
00:03:32.332 --> 00:03:37.510
And of course, media types that you'll
encounter as you usually do networking.

60
00:03:37.510 --> 00:03:41.620
Now to wrap everything up with all
of the different concepts that we've

61
00:03:41.620 --> 00:03:44.380
been talking about as well
as the network hardware,

62
00:03:44.380 --> 00:03:49.250
we would then, we'll tie that all together
in understanding network infrastructures.

63
00:03:49.250 --> 00:03:53.666
We'll talk about LANS and
WANS as well as internet, externet and

64
00:03:53.666 --> 00:03:56.327
internet concepts that are out there.

65
00:03:56.327 --> 00:03:59.503
Understand a little bit more
about wireless networking,

66
00:03:59.503 --> 00:04:03.734
as well as this idea of the different
network depologies and access methods.

67
00:04:03.734 --> 00:04:08.745
So if you are actually ready to take
your first step forward towards

68
00:04:08.745 --> 00:04:13.487
learning more about networking and
a networking career in IT,

69
00:04:13.487 --> 00:04:19.768
this is the right place and it begins with
your very next click on the first episode.

70
00:04:19.768 --> 00:04:27.423
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie introduce us to basic communication as the analogy for computer networking.  The team discusses the purpose and use of the OSI networking model and the TCP/IP model.  They show examples of networking using Windows Server.
episodes.title: Understand the OSI Networking Model

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie introduce us to basic communication as the analogy for computer networking.  The duo discuss the OSI communication process.  Using the postal service as an analogy, they show how each layer of the OSI model encapsulates and decapsulate the message.
episodes.title: Understand the OSI Networking Model Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie introduce us to basic communication as the analogy for computer networking.  The team discusses the purpose and use of the OSI networking model and the TCP/IP model.  They show examples of networking using Windows Server.
episodes.title: Understand the OSI Networking Model Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie discuss the purpose and place fo the MAC Address.  They show where to find it and why it's important to networking. The emphasize the importance of getting to know about the binary conversion for any professional networking based certification exam.
episodes.title: Understand Addressing: Binary

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie discuss the purpose and place fo the MAC Address.  They show where to find it and why it's important to networking.  They discuss the components of the MAC address and how it helps in forwarding data.
episodes.title: Understand Addressing: MAC Address

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie discuss the purpose and place fo the IPv4 Address.  They show where to find it and why it's important to networking.  They discuss the components of the IP address and how it helps in forwarding data.
episodes.title: Understand Addressing: IPv4 Address

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie discuss the purpose and place fo the IPv6 Address.  They show where to find it and why it's important to networking.  They discuss the components of the IP address and how it helps in forwarding data.
episodes.title: Understand Addressing: IPv6 Address

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie discuss the purpose and uses for Windows Services.  The duo discuss 3 commonly found services on enterprise networks and demonstrate them working: DNS, DHCP and Remote Access, respectively.
episodes.title: Understand Network Services

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie discuss the use of common command line based tools.  They a demonstrate variety of command line tools useful for connecting to servers and troubleshooting.
episodes.title: Understand TCP/IP Tools

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie discuss network hardware switches.  They describe the switch hardware, The differentiate a switch from a hub too.  Lastly, they discuss the use of virtual switches
episodes.title: Understand Switches: Hardware

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie discuss the use of common command line based tools.  They a demonstrate variety of command line tools useful for connecting to servers and troubleshooting.
episodes.title: Understand Switches: Functionality

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie discuss router functionality and how a router works.  They talk about static routing and dynamic routing along with default routes.
episodes.title: Understand Routers: Functionality

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie show how to do some basic router configuration.  They demonstrate how to install the routing and remote access role for a Windows Router working as a LAN router.  They configure a static route and show how to configure a routing protocol on the Windows Server router
episodes.title: Understand Routers: Configure a Router

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie review some of the most commonly used types of media used in networking.  The team describes some of the details of fiber optics, copper cabling and wireless as networking medial.  They show and describe some of the characteristics, including issues with using them.
episodes.title: Understand Network Media

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie review some of the most commonly used types of media used in networking.  The team describes some of the details of fiber optics, copper cabling and wireless as networking medial.  They show and describe some of the characteristics, including issues with using them.
episodes.title: Understand Network Media Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie review some of the most commonly used wireless networking technology.  The team describes some of the wireless media and standards used.  They discuss it application what we need to remember implementing wireless.
episodes.title: Understand Network Media Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie review some of the most commonly used wireless networking technology.  The team describes some of the wireless media and standards used.  They discuss it application what we need to remember implementing wireless.
episodes.title: Understand Network Media Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie help us to understand some networking technoglies like VPNs and Firewalls and creating security zones. The team also describe network topologies.
episodes.title: Understand Technologies and Topologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie help us to understand some networking technoglies like VPNs and Firewalls and creating security zones. The team also describe network topologies.
episodes.title: Understand Technologies and Topologies Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie help us to understand some networking technoglies like VPNs and Firewalls and creating security zones. The team also describe network topologies.
episodes.title: Understand Technologies and Topologies Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie tackle LAN concepts.  They describe technology found in a LAN infrastructure.  Also described is address management and the use of RFC 1918 addresses and VLANs.  Lastly, discuss the components of wired and wireless LANs.
episodes.title: Understand Infrastructure: LAN

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie discuss the different technologies for WANs--Wide Area Networks.  They discuss the different service provider offerings and their characteristics.
episodes.title: Understand Infrastructure: WAN
